arm_group.description: Proprioceptive pressure therapy using a a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : 15 to 25 mmHg.
LYCRA® non-compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : < 5 mmHg.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of a 6 months upper arm proprioceptive
      pressure therapy on Assisting Hand Assessment ("AHA") performance in Cerebral Palsy (CP). To
      perform this study, 80 CP patients aged of 5 to 10 years old will be included in a
      multicentric, double blind, prospective parallel-group randomized study. Treatment will be a
      pressure therapy using a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy. Primary
      outcome is to increase of 60% of AHA performance. The secondary outcome are to increase
      Quality of Upper Extremity Skill Test (QUEST), quality of life and improve Somatosensory
      Evoked Potentials (SEP).

clinical_study.brief_title: Pressure Therapy in the Treatment of Upper Arm of Cerebral Palsy Children

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of a 6 months upper arm proprioceptive
      pressure therapy on Assisting Hand Assessment ("AHA") performance in Cerebral Palsy (CP). To
      perform this study, 80 CP patients aged of 5 to 10 years old will be included in a
      multicentric, double blind, prospective parallel-group randomized study. Treatment will be a
      pressure therapy using a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy. Primary
      outcome is to increase of 60% of AHA performance. The secondary outcome are to increase
      Quality of Upper Extremity Skill Test (QUEST), quality of life and improve Somatosensory
      Evoked Potentials (SEP)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children with upper limb with pre/peri birth etiologic CP.

          -  Children aged 5 to 10 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Children with language dysfunction

          -  LYCRA® allergia

          -  Botulic Toxin injection on upper limb 4 month before inclusion

intervention.description: Proprioceptive pressure therapy using a a LYCRA® compressive sleeve initially used in burn therapy : 15 to 25 mmHg.
intervention.other_name: Proprioceptive pressure therapy by Medical Z

keyword: multicentric, double blind, prospective parallel-group randomized study
clinical_study.official_title: Pressure Therapy in the Treatment of Upper Arm of Cerebral Palsy Children

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Marc Sautelet, Villeneuve d'Ascq, France

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: Assisting Hand Assessment performance is a functional test to assess hand function for children with unilateral upper limb disabilities.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Upper Extremity skill Test is a functional test to assess upper limb mobility for children with unilateral upper limb disabilities.
Somatosensory Evoked Potentials (SEP) is a functional test to assess sensory nerve conduction

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
